qas.question: What were the Libyan people instructed to create in conjunction with the Popular Revolution?
Along with the bureaucracy, who were the General People's Committees directed at?
What political system did Gaddafi claim was less democratic than the General People's Committees?

context: As part of this Popular Revolution, Gaddafi invited Libya's people to found <a0_0>General People's Committees<a0_0/> as conduits for raising political consciousness. Although offering little guidance for how to set up these councils, Gaddafi claimed that they would offer a form of direct political participation that was more democratic than a <a2_0>traditional party-based representative<a2_0/> system. He hoped that the councils would mobilize the people behind the RCC, erode the power of the <a1_0>traditional leaders<a1_0/> and the bureaucracy, and allow for a new legal system chosen by the people.
